channel.title: career on Unique Divine
channel.description: Recent content in career on Unique Divine

item.title: Going Undefeated: How to Make Battle Plans For Life
item.description: Last Summer, I made the declaration to transition from PhD physics track to industry data scientist in under a year. That is, by June of this year. As this is somewhat of a hot field, I realized that this wil take a great deal of transformation and growth on my part. In my current state, I’m far from the ideal candidate listed in these job descriptions. My undergraduate background isn’t in computer science, data science, or statistics.

item.title: Breaking Into Data Science II:
item.description: I heard somebody say a few weeks back to “teach the thing you want to learn”. It seemed a bit paradoxical at first, but I decided to wrestle with the idea a bit: “How can I teach something when I don’t know much about it? How can I give someone useful advice about how to accomplish a goal that I’ve been unsuccesful in up to this point? I’ll become a canonical example of the blind leading the blind.

item.title: Breaking Into Data Science I: Plan of Attack
item.description: In 5th grade, one of my classmates fell down and broke his arm during a game of two-hand touch football, so the elementary school banned the sport during recess. I was pretty upset about this. Lots of kids were. This was Texas, afterall, and we loved our football. I experimented with other recess activies: hopscotch, double dutch, chalk drawing, tetherball, basketball, dodgeball, kickball. Many of these activites just didn’t do it for me.
